Member Function Documentation

void anonymous_namespace{usbCallbacks.cpp}::CCallbacks::OnInit ( void   )  [private, virtual]

Callback API (usb_api_callbacks).

These callback functions are used by the USB API to notify the user application of incoming events or actions to perform. Initialization callback function This callback is invoked whenever the USB API is initialized using the CUsbDriver::Init function. It should perform the following operations:

  1. If an OS is being used, install the USB driver
  2. Configure the USB controller interrupt
  3. Configure the VBus monitoring interrupt Attention: Implementation of this callback is mandatory
    See also:
    CUsbDriver::Init

Implements USB::CEventSink.

void anonymous_namespace{usbCallbacks.cpp}::CCallbacks::OnReset ( void   )  [private, virtual]

Reset callback function.

Invoked whenever the device is reset by the host. This function should perform initialization or re-initialization of the user application. Attention: Implementation of this callback is optional

See also:
CUsbDriver::EventHandler

Implements USB::CEventSink.

void anonymous_namespace{usbCallbacks.cpp}::CCallbacks::OnSuspend ( void   )  [private, virtual]

Suspend callback function.

Invoked when the device is suspended by the host or detached from the bus. If the device must enter low-power mode when suspended, then the necessary code must be implemented here.

See also:
CUsbDriver::Attach

CUsbDriver::EventHandler

Implements USB::CEventSink.

void anonymous_namespace{usbCallbacks.cpp}::CCallbacks::OnResume ( void   )  [private, virtual]

Resume callback function.

Invoked when the device is resumed by the host or attached to the bus. If the suspend callback has put the device into low-power mode, then this function must perform the necessary actions to return it to a normal mode of operation.

See also:
CEventSink::OnSuspend

CUsbDriver::Attach

CUsbDriver::EventHandler

Implements USB::CEventSink.

void anonymous_namespace{usbCallbacks.cpp}::CCallbacks::OnNewRequest ( void   )  [private, virtual]

New Request callback function.

Invoked when a new SETUP request is received. The request can then be retrieved by using the GetSetup function on the CUsbDriver instance.

See also:
CUsbDriver::EventHandler

Implements USB::CEventSink.
